intro: Desmodium frutescens var. amblyophyllum, commonly known as sour milkweed, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and clusters of pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in some African communities for various health purposes.
